name: Blueberry Skyr Muffins
author: LauraF
summary: I fell in love with skyr when I visited Iceland a few years ago. It's a mild, thick yogurt and high in protein as an added bonus. I used blueberry-flavored skyr to make these muffins and it gave them such a tender texture!
ingredients: 1 stick unsalted butter, at room temperature
½ cup brown sugar, or more to taste
1 (5.3 ounce) container blueberry skyr (such as Siggi's®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners
Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
Add eggs one at a time, beating well between each addition
Mix in blueberry yogurt, honey, and lemon zest
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl
Gradually add to the yogurt mixture and mix until well combined
Fold in blueberries using a spatula
Divide batter among prepared muffin cups
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes
Cool in the pan for 5 minutes
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
